author: Johann Hari

author: Brian Tracy
title: Eat That Frog

author: Scott Carney
title: What Doesn't Kill Us
desc: What Doesn't Kill Us, traces our evolutionary journey back to a time when survival depended on how well we adapted to the environment around us. Our ancestors crossed deserts, mountains, and oceans without even a whisper...

author: Dale Carnegie
title: How to stop worrying and start living
desc: The book 'How to stop worrying and start living' suggest many ways to conquer worry and lead a wonderful life. The book mentions fundamental facts to know about worry and magic formula for solving worry-some situations.

title: Emotions
desc: God has gifted us with emotions since the very beginning—and he did so with very concrete purposes in mind—so that we can enjoy life, so we can connect with others, and so we can reflect God's image in us. But too often...

author: Nick Vujicic
Kanae Vujicic
title: Love Without Limits

author: Tyler McNamer
title: Population One
desc: Being different from the masses is one of the greatest gifts that you possess! Let s face it: Who wants to be just like everyone else? Talk about boring! People come in all shapes and sizes and are born with natural...

author: Francine Shapiro
title: Getting Past Your Past
desc: A totally accessible user's guide from the creator of a scientifically proven form of psychotherapy that has successfully treated millions of people worldwide. Whether we've experienced small setbacks or major traumas.

author: Will M. Tuttle
title: The World Peace Diet
desc: Tuttle offers a set of universal principles for all people of conscience, from any religious tradition, to help them reconnect with what they are eating, what was required to get it on their plates--and what happens after it leaves their plates.

author: John Robbins
title: Diet for a New America
desc: From John Robbins, a new edition of the classic that awakened the conscience of a nation. Since the 1987 publication of Diet for a New America, beef consumption in the United States has fallen a remarkable 19%.

author: Caroline P. Murphy
title: Murder of a Medici Princess
desc: A vast treasure trove of newly discovered and unpublished documents illuminates the brilliant life and tragic death of Isabella de Medici, one of the brightest stars in Renaissance Italy, in this fast-paced narrative...

author: Charles Houston Harris
Louis R. Sadler

author: David Aikman
title: Great Souls
desc: Aikman profiles six figures who embody specific virtues including Bill Graham, Nelson Mandela, Mother Teresa, Pope John Paul II and others.

author: Ingrid Seward

author: Amanda Foreman
title: Georgiana, Duchess of Devonshire

author: Randall Bennett Woods
title: Shadow Warrior

author: Mark Ribowsky
title: The Last Cowboy: A Life of Tom Landry
desc: A biography of the legendary professional football coach, known for his trademark fedora, who spent almost thirty years taking the Dallas Cowboys from punchline to NFL glory, ultimately delivering twenty consecutive winning seasons.

author: John Perry
title: Pershing
desc: No other American military leader is so important and yet so little known as John J. Pershing. He led an army of more than a million men in France, defeating the seemingly invincible German war machine with only six months...

author: David Finch

author: Michael Hingson

title: Thunder Dog
desc: Recounts the events of September 11, 2001 as a blind man, trusting in his guide dog, escapes from the World Trade Center's north tower.

author: Elizabeth Lev
title: The Tigress of Forlì
desc: An examination of the Renaissance countess explores her marriage at the age of ten into a corrupt pope's influential family, her fierce rule after the assassination of her husband, and the inspiring resistance she led against the Borgia family.

author: Randall Bennett Woods
